title: 4.CSY.1
text: The student will model how a computing system works to accomplish a task.
subject: Computer Science (2024)
subs: Describe how computing systems perceive the world through sensors and other inputs.
Compare and contrast how humans and computers process information from inputs.
Explain how computing devices may be used to classify and organize input.
Diagram and describe a simple computing system indicating processors, inputs, and outputs.

title: 4.CSY.2
text: The student will apply troubleshooting strategies when a computing system is not working as intended.
subject: Computer Science (2024)
subs: Identify hardware, software, and connectivity problems using accurate terminology.
Apply troubleshooting strategies to address hardware, software, and connectivity problems.

title: 4.CSY.3
text: The student will describe the learning process of humans and computers.
subject: Computer Science (2024)
subs: Compare and contrast how humans and computing technologies collect, store, and process data.
Identify similarities and differences on how humans and computing technologies infer and extract meaning from data.
Define machine learning and identify machine learning approaches: supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.
